raw_comment:
Although the text states that these graphs do not include imports and exports, they most likely do not reflect the complete amount of energy generated by each nation. The overall consumption of any of these nations would be higher if they were net importers of energy, and lower if they were net exporters. 

I wonder what factors play into the fact that India's energy usage is so low compared to China and the united states', I would expect it to be lower compared to those two but that low?

This is important to my community because, as I become older, technology becomes more and more integrated into every part of life, leading to a greater usage of electricity. Environmental preservation may be achieved by the widespread use of clean power generation.

POWER POWER POWER AND MORE POWER !
ace_sentences: The text states that the graphs do not include imports and exports.
The graphs most likely do not reflect the complete amount of energy generated by each nation.
A nation can be a net importer of energy.
A nation can be a net exporter of energy.
If a nation is a net importer of energy then the overall energy consumption of the nation is higher than the energy generation in the graphs.
If a nation is a net exporter of energy then the overall energy consumption of the nation is lower than the energy generation in the graphs.
India has low energy usage compared to China.
India has low energy usage compared to the United States.
I wonder what factors explain the low energy usage of India.
I expect that the energy usage of India is lower than the energy usage of China.
I expect that the energy usage of India is lower than the energy usage of the United States.
I did not expect that the energy usage of India is so low.
This topic is important to my community.
Technology becomes more integrated into every part of life.
If technology becomes more integrated into every part of life then the usage of electricity increases.
Environmental preservation may be achieved by the widespread use of clean power generation.
